explanation: The traffic sign of the question designates "No Entry Zone."

text: In the areas where it is prohibited to park or stop, you must not stop even when you need to circumvent dangers.
explanation: You may stop in the areas where it is prohibited to park if you have to do so in order to circumvent dangers.

text: When you park your vehicle on a road with a side strip of less than 0.75 meter in width, you are to park along the left edge of the roadway.
explanation: You should park along the left edge of the road as mentioned in the question.

text: If crossing or making U-Turns would impede the progress of other vehicles, you may not cross or make U-turns even in the areas where executing these actions is allowed.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: It is prohibited to cut in front of a vehicle displaying this symbol shown in the diagram, but it is allowed to pass in close proximity.
explanation: Passing in close proximity to the vehicle displaying the physically disabled driver's mark is also prohibited.

text: On roads with three or more undesignated vehicular lanes going in the same direction, vehicles may choose any one of the lanes to proceed on according to the speed they are traveling at, with the exception of the rightmost lane.
explanation: The right most lane should be left open for overtaking; the slow-moving vehicles should travel on the left lane, and the fast-moving cars should proceed on the right lane.

text: This hand signal and this hand signal of the police officers have the same meaning.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Two-wheeled vehicles should straddle two vehicular lanes and proceed while zigzagging to make themselves more visible to other drivers.
explanation: Two-wheeled vehicles must not straddle two vehicular lanes.

text: A vehicle with new tires, traveling at 100km/h on a dry national highway requires a space of 100 meters between itself and the vehicle in front.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: If you are approaching an intersection and your lane is direction designated as well as bounded by a yellow line, you must not change lanes across that line even if you wish to turn at the intersection.
explanation: You must not cross over the yellow line even for making a right or a left turn.

text: Vehicles with automatic transmission are designed to start with the change lever in either the P (Parking) or N (Neutral) position, and it is most common to start the engine while the change lever is in the P position.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you attempt to execute a right turn, you should proceed as depicted by the arrow shown in the diagram.
explanation: When turning right, you must first move to the middle of the road, and proceed to the point just short of the center of the intersection at a reduced speed.

text: The higher the height of a load, the more stable the vehicle becomes because the center of gravity is lowered.
explanation: The center of gravity becomes higher as you increase the height of the loads you are carrying, thereby making the vehicle less stable.

text: You may ride double on mopeds as long as the passenger also wears a crash helmet.
explanation: You must not ride double on mopeds even if the passenger is wearing a crash helmet.

text: When turning to the left, the rear wheels of a vehicle follow the outside paths of the front wheels, so the left front wheel should be kept as close to the edge of the corner as possible.
explanation: If the left front wheel is steered too close to the edge of the corner, the left rear wheel will run off the road when turning left.

text: While approaching an intersection with a traffic sign indicating for you to slow down, you passed through the intersection without slowing down because the vehicle traveling on the crossroad was still far away.
explanation: You must slow down in the areas where a traffic sign designating to slow down is present, even if the other traffic is far away.

text: A person who is under the age of twenty, and has had a large- or regular-size motorcycle license for less than three years may not ride double on expressways.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: On roads where the pavement marking shown in the diagram is present, you must not change lanes as depicted by the arrow in the illustration.
explanation: You may change lanes because there is no yellow line on your side of the road.

text: Vehicles may proceed though a safety zone if it is imperative to do so.
explanation: Safety zones are provided to guarantee the safety of pedestrians. Vehicles must not enter safety zones under any circumstances.

text: Once you have entered an intersection, you are allowed to make a right turn before the vehicles attempting to turn left or go straight.
explanation: Even when you are already inside the intersection, you must not impede the progress of the vehicles moving straight or turning left.

text: You must not overtake a vehicle in front of you, if it is attempting to overtake a moped.
explanation: It is not prohibited to overtake a vehicle, which is attempting to overtake a moped.

text: Your license will not be revoked if you instigate a driver to commit a traffic violation of engaging in consorted dangerous acts as long as you are not driving.
explanation: Your license will be revoked even if you are not driving.

text: If a novice driver commits a traffic violation(s) and is placed into a special category of drivers, he/she must take a make up examination if he/she does not complete a novice-driver course without a valid reason.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When driving, you must meet the requirements (e.g. wearing glasses, and so on) which are listed on your driver's license.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When turning to the right or left at an intersection with a traffic light indicating a flashing red light, you must stop at the stop line and proceed at a reduced speed.
explanation: As described in the passage, you must stop, and after confirming safety, you may proceed at a reduced speed.

scenario: You are about to make a right turn. What do you have to keep in mind when you execute the right turn?
text: A vehicle, blocked from your view, may dash out from behind the large truck, so confirm the safety of the oncoming traffic after passing by the large-size truck.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are about to make a right turn. What do you have to keep in mind when you execute the right turn?
text: Execute the right turn quickly because there are vehicles behind you, and if you stop before the pedestrian crossing located in the direction you are turning, you might block the progress of the oncoming vehicles.
explanation: There is a possibility of colliding into a vehicle which is hidden behind the large-size truck, or with pedestrians crossing the pedestrian crossing.

scenario: You are about to make a right turn. What do you have to keep in mind when you execute the right turn?
text: Make a right turn so as not to block the progress of the people crossing the pedestrian crossing located in the direction you are turning.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: Since riders in general tend to speed up on uphill slopes, watch your speed at the curve shown on the left so as to confirm the safety of the traffic conditions ahead.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: Pay close attention to the oncoming truck, which may speed up on the downhill slope and cross over the halfway line into your side of the road at the curve.
explanation: There is a possibility that the oncoming vehicle could cross over the halfway line into your side of the road.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: Speed up and proceed forward because the oncoming truck would not cross over the halfway line.
explanation: There is a possibility that the oncoming vehicle could cross over the halfway line into your side of the road.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: Since you cannot see any oncoming vehicles, cross over the halfway line into the oncoming lane and quickly pass the bus in front.
explanation: A pedestrian may dash out from behind the parked bus.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: A pedestrian may dash out from the back of the parked bus, so reduce to a speed at which you can come to an immediate halt right before you pass the parked bus.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are driving at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: A pedestrian may dash out from the back of the parked bus, so sound the car horn while passing by the parked bus.
explanation: This is the improper use of the car horn. You must move to the center of the road in advance, and confirm the safety of the oncoming traffic.

scenario: You are proceeding on the expressway at a speed of 80km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you go into the tunnel ahead?
text: The vehicle ahead of you may suddenly reduce its speed, so maintain a safe distance from the vehicle in front.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding on the expressway at a speed of 80km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you go into the tunnel ahead?
text: When you enter the tunnel at a high speed, the visibility may be affected and momentarily worsens. Therefore reduce the speed in advance of entering the tunnel.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding on the expressway at a speed of 80km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you go into the tunnel ahead?
text: When you enter the tunnel at a high speed, the visibility may be affected and momentarily worsens. Therefore, increase your speed so as to shorten the distance from the vehicle ahead.
explanation: You may collide into the vehicle in front of you if you shorten the distance from the car in front.

scenario: You are crossing the railroad crossing. What do you have to keep in mind when crossing?
text: Since the vehicle behind you is approaching you, you should pull up as close as you can to the vehicle in front.
explanation: The vehicle in front of you may back up instead of moving forward. Maintain a safe distance from the vehicle ahead.

scenario: You are crossing the railroad crossing. What do you have to keep in mind when crossing?
text: There is a possibility that you may back up instead of moving forward, so apply the hand brake before proceeding.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are crossing the railroad crossing. What do you have to keep in mind when crossing?
text: Since the vehicle in front of you has already confirmed safety, shift the gear into the low position and cross the railroad crossing without stopping.
explanation: You must stop right before entering the railroad crossing, and confirm safety with your own eyes and ears.

text: Drivers do not need to be concerned about other drivers or pedestrians in the traffic as long as they are observing traffic regulations.
explanation: It is important to maintain the attitude of give-and-take and consideration for other drivers or pedestrians in the traffic.

text: When driving a two-wheeled vehicle, a driver should hold the handlebars lightly, with his/her wrists positioned downward, pressing the bars slightly forward within the grip.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: A driver should not generate annoying loud noises, make jackrabbit starts, accelerate suddenly, or race the engine.
explanation: It is prohibited to drive making extremely loud noises that would disturb others.

text: Irrespective of the type of motor vehicle, a driver should cover any loads and packages they are carrying with a cover sheet in order to prevent debris from falling from the vehicle.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Drivers should not park on steep downward slopes, but they can park on steep upward slopes.
explanation: Parking and stopping is prohibited on steep uphill slopes and downhill slopes.

text: It would be dangerous to apply engine braking excessively on a long downward slope because the brakes will fail.
explanation: No matter how much engine braking is applied, it would not lead to the breakdown of the braking mechanisms.

text: When the traffic sign shown on the right is displayed, vehicles with seating capacity over 11 are not allowed to pass through the street, but vehicles with a seating capacity of 10 or less may pass through.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Child seats are effective not only in reducing injuries in an accident, but also in preventing children from interfering with driving.
explanation: Use the child seats properly by following the instructions of the manufacture.

text: When riding a two-wheeled vehicle in a priority lane for route buses, you kept on going even though you saw a kindergarten bus approaching from behind because the bus was not one of the priority vehicles.
explanation: Kindergarten buses are priority vehicles. You must leave the priority lane immediately if you see them approaching.

text: When cornering on two-wheeled vehicles, the rider should naturally tilt the motorcycle instead of steering the handlebars.
explanation: When going around curves, you should maneuver as the passage describes.

text: When a streetcar is stopped at a station located inside a safety zone, you must stop behind the streetcar and wait until all the passengers have finished getting on and off.
explanation: You may proceed at a reduced speed when you pass by safety zones.

text: If you detected any slack or a spongy feeling when you depress the brake pedal of a four-wheeled vehicles, it is a sign that the brakes are working effectively.
explanation: A slack or spongy brake pedal is a sign that the brakes are faulty.

text: When you drive a four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you do not have to pay close attention to the change lever because this type of car basically runs with the handling of the accelerator pedal and brake pedal.
explanation: You must also pay attention to the change lever.

text: While riding a two-wheeled vehicle, you felt an earthquake, so you pulled over to the left side of the road, locked the handlebars and left to find shelter.
explanation: You must not leave the vehicle without putting locks on it.

text: It is prohibited to stop or park inside tunnels regardless of their width, or the presence of vehicular lanes.
explanation: You must not stop or park inside any tunnels.

text: When you drive a vehicle carrying loads such as shown on the right, you are required to obtain a permit from the police chief having jurisdiction over the place of departure.
explanation: You need a permit because the load size exceeds one tenth of the length of the vehicle.

text: When you drive at night, it is advisable to focus your eyes up close because the field of vision is narrowed down at night.
explanation: You should try to look as far ahead as possible when driving at night.

text: You may enter the exclusive lanes for route buses if it is inevitable that you do so in order to circumvent dangers.
explanation: You may enter the exclusive lanes for route buses if it is inevitable that you do so in circumventing dangers.

text: When the hand signals of a police officer differ from that of the traffic light, you should follow the traffic light signals.
explanation: The hand signals of a police officer are given priority over the traffic light signals.

text: Both traffic signs shown on the right refer to the same meanings for the vehicles proceeding forward.
explanation: The traffic signal on the left designates 'No Entry for Vehicles,' and the one on the right designates 'Closed to All Vehicles,' both of which regulate vehicles not to proceed forward.

text: When you drive through water, and water gets into the braking system, this causes the brakes to work even more effectively.
explanation: The brakes may temporarily fail.

text: On the roads where there is not enough space on the left side of the road, you may cross into the right side of the road.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When pedestrians or bicycles are crossing a pedestrian crossing or a bicycle crossing, you must slow down before the crossing.
explanation: You must stop at the stop line before entering these crossings.

text: When a police officer gives a hand signal by holding out his arms horizontally, it is equivalent to a red traffic light for the traffic facing the police officer.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you inspect your tires you should check (1)the air pressure, (2)the wear and tear and (3)the depth of the tire treads.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you apply the brakes of two-wheeled vehicles you should apply the rear-wheel brake more firmly when the road surface is dry, and apply the front-wheel brake more firmly when the road surface is wet.
explanation: When the road surface is dry you should apply the front-wheel brake more firmly, and when the road surface is slippery apply the rear-wheel brake more firmly.

text: In the illustration shown on the right Vehicle A must wait inside the intersection until Vehicle B passes through.
explanation: Even if Vehicle A enters the intersection prior to Vehicle B, Vehicle A must not impede the progress of traffic moving forward.

text: The width of two-wheeled vehicles is narrow, so they could drive on the side strip of expressways when the traffic is congested.
explanation: Two-wheeled vehicles are not allowed to proceed on the side strips.

text: You must not cut in front of the vehicle which you have just overtaken.
explanation: Make sure you can see the vehicle you have just overtaken in the rearview mirror before you move in front.

text: When you park beside a parking meter you must activate the meter immediately.
explanation: You must activate the meter as soon as you park.

text: You should inspect vehicles for business use or large-size trucks for personal use every three months. Regular vehicles used for personal use should be inspected annually.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The amount of brake fluid should be somewhere in between the top and bottom lines shown in the reserve tank.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right indicates that there is a "dead end" ahead.
explanation: The traffic sign in the question warns 'Other Unexpected Dangers.'

text: You must not overtake inside tunnels regardless of whether or not there are vehicular lanes.
explanation: You may overtake other vehicles inside tunnels with vehicular lanes.

text: When the vehicle in front of you gave a signal to move to the center of the road to turn right, there was a space on the right side of the vehicle so you passed on the right side of the vehicle.
explanation: The type of overtaking is extremely dangerous, therefore it is prohibited to do so.

text: When approaching an intersection or a curve with poor visibility at night, you should switch the high beams on and off quickly to warn other drivers or pedestrians.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You may overtake at corners of the road with a clear view with no oncoming traffic.
explanation: You may not overtake at corners of the road regardless of how good or bad the view is.

text: When proceeding on the main through lanes it is safer to drive using the white line on the left side of the lane as your guide and proceed on the section slightly to the left of the center of the vehicular lane you are proceeding in.
explanation: When traveling on the main through lanes, follow the descriptions of the passage.

text: Even on roads where the left side of the road is less than 6 meters in width with a good view, you must not cross over the solid yellow halfway line for overtaking.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right indicates that there is a bicycle crossing ahead.
explanation: The traffic sign of the question refers to a 'bicycle crossing.'

text: Halfway lines are not necessarily marked in the center of the road.
explanation: The location of the halfway lines sometimes changes depending on the roads.

text: Since two-wheeled vehicles are small, their speed appears slower than the actual speed, or the distance from them seems longer than the actual length, when looking at them from the driver's view of four-wheeled vehicles.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When approaching a pedestrian crossing, stop when people are crossing the street. If people are about to cross the street, move ahead slowly and with caution.
explanation: When a pedestrian is about to cross a street, you need to come to a temporary stop to let the pedestrian cross.

text: When your vehicle is stuck inside a railroad crossing, you must first alert the operator of any approaching trains and remove the vehicle out of the crossing as quickly as possible.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Using a cell-phone while driving helps you concentrate better on the surrounding traffic conditions and therefore you would not overlook dangers around you.
explanation: It is dangerous to use a cell-phone while driving because your concentration level greatly diminishes.

text: The height limit for cargo on trucks, large-size trucks, medium-size cargo vehicles, and heavy special equipment is 3.8 meters from the ground.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: At an intersection having no traffic lights, and in which the intersecting roads are of the same width, you must not impede the progress of vehicles entering the intersection from your left.
explanation: Vehicles must not impeded the progress of vehicles on their left.

text: When driving a long distance on a two-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you do not have to take any rest because it does not burden you with the clutch operation.
explanation: You must take a rest once every two hours even when you are riding a two-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission.

text: When you approach a corner in a road you should slow down while you are still on the straight section of the road before it starts to curve.
explanation: You should slow down sufficiently.

text: When driving a four-wheeled vehicle with a child inside, you do not have to use a child seat as long as a guardian is holding the child in his/her arms.
explanation: It is dangerous to hold a child in someone's arms when driving. The child must be safely strapped to a child seat.

text: You must not stop inside the side strip shown in the diagram even when you are letting the passengers get on and off.
explanation: This is a 'No Parking or Stopping Side Strip,' so you must not stop or park inside the side strip.

text: The centrifugal force increases as the radius of a curve shortens, and increases in proportion to the square of the speed.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When passing by a vehicle on a narrow road with one side of the road being the edge of a cliff, the vehicle on the side of the cliff should stop to yield the way to the oncoming vehicle.
explanation: The vehicle on the side of the cliff is to find a safe place to stop first and then yield the way.

text: When you drive by pedestrians, you must create a safe distance between or slow down.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: In areas where the traffic sign shown on the right is present, vehicles must not pass through, but pedestrians may pass through.
explanation: It indicates that pedestrians, vehicles, nor streetcars may pass through.

text: If a person drives after his/her driver's license has been revoked, it is equivalent to driving without a license.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Mini-cars, regular-size motorcycles of 125cc or less and mopeds (motorized bicycles) must not enter expressways.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You must not park your vehicle continuously in the same spot on public roads for more than 12 hours during the day, or 8 hours at night.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When the traffic light is indicating a green light, vehicles may go forward or turn left, however, turning right is not allowed.
explanation: When the traffic light is green, vehicles may go forward, turn left, or turn right.

text: Unless otherwise indicated by a traffic sign or a pavement marking on a public road, the maximum speed limit for a vehicle, equipped with the towing device hauling another vehicle which is also equipped with the device, is 60km/h.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The maximum load size limit for mopeds is up to the total length of the handlebars (measuring from the left edge to the right edge of the handlebars.)
explanation: Mopeds may carry a load that is the width of the load-carrying equipment plus 0.15 meter extending on either side of the equipment.

text: Drivers of two-wheeled vehicles who have had a regular motorcycle license for less than a year may not ride double even when the vehicle has a pillion seat.
explanation: As described in the passage, you must not ride double.

text: If no maximum speed limit is indicated by traffic signs or pavement markings on the main through lanes of national expressways with a median strip, the maximum speed limit is 100km/h.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you felt the rear tires of your vehicle skidding sideways, you firmly stepped on the brake pedal and steered in the opposite direction of the skidding.
explanation: When you feel the rear tires of your vehicle skidding sideways, you must steer in the direction of the skidding and do not apply the brakes.

text: In the areas where the pavement marking is as shown in the diagram, vehicles may shift lanes as depicted by the arrow.
explanation: You must not change lanes because there is a yellow line on the side of the road the vehicle is proceeding.

text: When you drive by safety zones, you must slow down only when pedestrians are present.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: On roads having two vehicular lanes going in the same direction, vehicles must proceed on the left vehicular lane.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: A person who has a large-size vehicle license may operate medium-size vehicles, semi medium-size vehicles, regular vehicles and mopeds.
explanation: The holder of a large-size vehicle license is entitled to drive large vehicles, medium-size vehicles, regular vehicles, light special equipment, and mopeds.

text: At an intersection regulated by the traffic sign shown on the right, large-size trucks may pass through.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You are prohibited from cutting in front of, or driving too close to vehicles displaying a "Learner Driver" mark, however, it is not prohibited from doing so to vehicles displaying "Senior Driver" or "Physically Disabled Driver" marks.
explanation: It is also prohibited to cut in front or drive too close to vehicles displaying 'Senior Driver' or 'Physically Disabled Driver' marks.

text: When you drove by a pedestrian walking with the aid of a seeing-eye dog, you reduced the speed to 30km/h, because you were unable to keep a safe distance from that person.
explanation: You must stop or slow down to let the person pass safely.

text: You must not pass or switch lanes to overtake vehicles or mopeds at railroad crossings or within 30 meters of railroad crossings.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: If there is an obstacle on the road ahead, the driver on the side of the obstacle always has the right of way over the oncoming vehicle.
explanation: The driver on the side of the obstacle must yield the way to the oncoming vehicle when passing.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 40 km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: On an empty road like this one, no oncoming vehicle would be expected, so proceed in the center of the road at the same speed.
explanation: On the uphill road, an oncoming vehicle may cross over the halfway line into your lane.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30 km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when making a left turn?
text: The cyclist may suddenly switch the direction he is going, so proceed at a reduced speed until the bicycle passes through the intersection.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30 km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when making a left turn?
text: A vehicle may come out from the crossroad, so reduce to a speed at which you can come to a halt before the intersection.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30 km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when making a left turn?
text: There is a possibility that you may collide with the bicycle when you turn left, so accelerate, pass the bicycle and make a left turn before the bicycle reaches the intersection.
explanation: You are at risk of colliding with the bicycle if you accelerate without confirming the movement of the bicycle.

text: The term engine braking refers to taking your foot off from the accelerator pedal so as to utilize the negative pressure within the cylinders to reduce the speed.
explanation: The term engine braking is correctly described in the passage of the question.

text: When you are uncertain about whether or not there is a pedestrian on a pedestrian crossing, you may pass through it without altering the speed.
explanation: You must reduce to a speed at which you can come to a safe stop.

text: When the width of the left-hand side of a road is less than 6 meters, you may enter the right-hand side of the road for overtaking even if the road has an obstructed view.
explanation: If you are driving on a road with an obstructed view, you must not enter the right-hand part of the road for overtaking other vehicles.

text: Two-wheeled vehicles have high maneuverability, but you must not squeeze between other vehicles.
explanation: It is dangerous as well as disturbing to other drivers.

text: The traffic light shown in the diagram is equivalent to the hand signal and the flashlight signal of the police officers.
explanation: As the passage indicates, all of the signals have the same meanings.

text: When driving in an urban district, you must not drive with the headlights on low beam.
explanation: When driving in urban districts, you must have the headlights on low beam.

text: It is prohibited to stop or park within 10 meters of a bus stop sign during business hours so as not to impede the operation of route buses.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: It is advisable to avoid driving when the atmosphere has been contaminated with photochemical smog or when it is forecasted that the air will be polluted.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When passing alongside a bus which is stopped at a bus station, it is reasonable to assume that a pedestrian may suddenly come out from behind the bus.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You must slow down at or around the top of a hill or on long and gradual downhill slopes.
explanation: You do not have to slow down on long and gradual downhill slopes.

text: You are supposed to drive at a speed of 50km/h in areas regulated by the traffic sign shown on the right.
explanation: This traffic sign refers to the starting point of the traffic regulation indicating the maximum speed limit of 50km/h.

text: You must not drive a vehicle having a seating capacity of more than 11 people with a regular driver's license.
explanation: You must have a large-size or medium-size vehicle license to drive vehicles having a seating capacity of over 11 people.

text: A person who has had a regular driver's license may ride a moped (a motorized bicycle) on national expressways.
explanation: You must not enter national expressways on moped.

text: When you are traveling in one direction, you must give a signal to indicate your intention of changing lanes 3 seconds in advance.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: It is not advisable to step on the brake pedal several times in succession because the brake lights will flicker and disturb the drivers behind you.
explanation: Stepping on the brake pedal several times in succession will warn vehicles behind you and prevent rear-end collisions.

text: Regular vehicles must not proceed through in priority lanes shown on the right, during the hours from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. even if there is relatively little traffic.
explanation: You may proceed in the priority lane only if you could leave the priority lane as soon as you see a bus approaching.

text: When you were riding a two-wheeled vehicle, a moped was stopped in front of a pedestrian crossing, so you stopped beside the moped before passing through the pedestrian crossing.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You should slow down before entering tunnels because sudden changes in brightness momentarily reduce your visual acuity.
explanation: Slow down and drive with caution.

text: When your vehicle breaks down on an expressway and you are unable to drive, you should seek a safe place instead of remaining inside the car, after taking necessary measures to obviate dangers.
explanation: You should seek a safe place, after taking necessary measures to obviate dangers.

text: Signaling unnecessarily or inappropriately would confuse other drivers in traffic and incur danger.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right designates mopeds to take right turns at the intersection in the similar fashion as regular vehicles.
explanation: The traffic sign designates mopeds to make a right turn, using "the direct turn" method.

text: When crossing a railroad crossing in a four-wheeled vehicle, you should shift the gear into the low position, and not change gears until you are all the way through.
explanation: You should not shift gears inside railroad crossings.

text: The rider of large- or regular-size motorcycles has to wear a crash helmet, whereas the rider of mopeds does not.
explanation: When you ride a moped, you must also wear a crash helmet.

text: You must slow down or reduce speed so as not to impede the progress of pedestrians, even when they are walking in the vicinity of an intersection without a pedestrian crossing.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you apply the brakes on a two-wheeled vehicle, you must straighten the body of the motorcycle and apply the brakes of the front wheel and rear wheel simultaneously without turning the handlebars.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When a police officer has his arms stretched out vertically above his head, the traffic facing the officer, or coming from behind him, must stop, whereas the traffic coming from the other directions may proceed with caution.
explanation: The officer's hand signal is equivalent to a yellow light for the traffic moving in the directions lateral to the officer.

text: Vehicles which have a permit to proceed through streetcar tracks may stay on the tracks even when a streetcar is approaching from behind.
explanation: You must maintain a sufficient distance from the streetcar, otherwise you must leave the tracks.

text: Vehicles, such as tractors, which are structurally incapable of moving faster than 50km/h must not proceed through the main through lanes of national expressways.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: As long as the owner of a vehicle takes out a policy in a compulsory insurance, he/she does not need to have optional liability insurance.
explanation: You are required to take out a policy in optional liability insurance as a measure of precaution.

text: Vehicles for business use such as buses or taxis must be inspected once every day before operating.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Two-wheeled vehicles are not big obstacles to traffic compared to four-wheeled vehicles, so you may park your motorcycle in the areas where parking is prohibited.
explanation: You must not park two-wheeled vehicles in the areas where parking is prohibited.

text: As the speed increases, your visual acuity for focusing on objects nearby as well as far away increases.
explanation: As the speed increases, it becomes harder to see the objects nearby.

text: When you proceed as depicted by the arrow shown in the diagram, you must slow down at position A.
explanation: The road you are proceeding on has the right of way, so you do not have to slow down at position A.

text: Even if you lost your driver's license, you would be allowed to drive as long as you had reported the loss to the local police.
explanation: Driving while your driver's license has been lost is equivalent to driving without a license. Your driver's license must be re-issued before you are allowed to drive again.

text: When the speed is decreased by half, kinetic energy generated at the time of collision is also halved.
explanation: When the speed is halved, kinetic energy generated at the time of collision is quartered.

text: You do not need to signal when backing up.
explanation: You must either switch on the reverse light, or use a hand signal for backing up.

text: The pavement marking shown on the right refers to a no parking zone.
explanation: The pavement marking of the question refers to a "No Entry Zone."

text: When you proceed through a railroad crossing with an obstructed view, it is advisable to gradually move forward until you obtain a good view so that you can confirm safety with your eyes.
explanation: It is dangerous to enter the railroad crossing. You must confirm safety at the stop line.

text: A driver parked to unload his vehicle for ten minutes on a road, which did not have 3.5 meters or more of clearance on the right side of the vehicle, however he knew that he would be able to move the vehicle at a moment's notice.
explanation: Parking on roads which do not have sufficient open space on the right side of a parked vehicle, is prohibited. However, you may park in this particular situation described in the passage.

text: On roads having no sidewalk or side strip, four-wheeled vehicles must not drive within 0.5 meter of the edge of the road.
explanation: As described in the passage, vehicles must not proceed on the shoulder of the road.

text: Drivers must not engage in selfish driving conduct such as generating loud noise and gas exhausts, and they should give consideration to residents living along the roads.
explanation: As members of the society, drivers must have responsibility and morals.

text: On roads having no vehicular lanes, vehicles must proceed on the left-hand side of the road.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct. (The rule of keeping to the left.)

text: It is effective to hang dangle-dollies on the rearview mirror because they reduce the monotony of driving and add fun to driving.
explanation: They obstruct your view and they can be distractive to your driving.

text: If a big earthquake should occur while driving, you are to pull over to the left side of the road. If you have to abandon your car on the road out of sheer necessity, engine key in the keyhole and switch off the engine.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The auxiliary sign shown on the right refers to the beginning of a traffic regulation.
explanation: The auxiliary sign shown in the question refers to the end of a traffic regulation.

text: Large- and regular-size motorcycles and mopeds have a maximum loading capacity of 60kg.
explanation: Mopeds may carry a maximum load of 30 kg.

text: It is advisable to take a rest at least once every two hours when you drive over long distances.
explanation: When you drive over long distances you are advised to take a rest at least once every two hours.

text: When driving at night and the glaring headlights of oncoming vehicles are disturbing to your eyes you should look ahead and focus your eyes slightly to the left.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right warns that there is a streetcar station ahead.
explanation: The traffic sign in the question warns that there is a railroad crossing ahead.

text: You must always stop if the traffic light is indicating a flashing yellow light.
explanation: You may proceed while giving caution to other traffic.

text: When you are driving at high speed on a wet surface and you experience a phenomenon called "hydroplaning," you should hold the steering wheel lightly and quickly reduce the speed by slamming on the brake pedal.
explanation: You should hold the steering wheel firmly, and apply the engine braking to reduce the speed.

text: Vehicles must obtain a permit to drive across a pedestrian walkway to enter a garage located alongside the road.
explanation: Drivers must slow down and give caution to the pedestrians when driving across the pedestrian walkway.

text: The driver of a four-wheeled vehicle is not required to make the person sitting in the front passenger seat wear the seat belt as long as the front passenger seat is equipped with an air-bag.
explanation: Even in the situation described in the question, the driver as well as the passenger must always wear the seat belts.

text: When it is raining you should drive at a slower and constant speed, and avoid sudden stops or abrupt steering.
explanation: Roads are slippery on rainy days, so you should drive in the manner the passage of the question describes.

text: In cases where you need to accelerate in order to overtake or switch lanes, you may exceed the regulated speed limit.
explanation: You must not exceed the speed limit even when you overtake other vehicles or shift lanes.

text: The reason for setting up limitations on the size and capacity of loads is to alleviate potential dangers and avoid disturbing others in the traffic.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: In areas where the pavement marking shown on the right is present, you must not park but you may stop.
explanation: The pavement marking of the question designates "No Parking," so you may stop.

text: A safe speed refers to driving at the speed which is regulated by law.
explanation: A safe speed refers to driving at a speed that is appropriate for traffic, weather, and visibility conditions.

text: On one-way roads, you may enter the right-hand side of the road.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: A person who has been issued a heavy special vehicle license may also drive medium-size and regular vehicles.
explanation: You may not drive medium-size vehicles or regular vehicles with a heavy special equipment license.

text: When you were approaching an intersection where the intersecting roads were of the same width and there was not traffic light, a moped had already approached the periphery of the intersection from the left. You then proceeded to enter the intersection before the moped because it was moving slowly.
explanation: You must not impede the progress of the traffic coming from the left.

text: You initiated to overtake a vehicle 100 meters in advance of a pedestrian crossing, but you realized that you approached within 30 meters of the crossing, so you dropped back behind the other vehicle.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: In the case of an accident you should leave the vehicle(s) and injured individual(s) unattended to keep the site of the accident unaltered for the police to examine.
explanation: You must give aid to the injured person and take measures to prevent further accidents from happening.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right prohibits vehicles from turning to the left or proceeding straight.
explanation: This traffic sign regulates vehicles to proceed in the directions designated by the arrows. You may not turn right, but you may turn left or proceed forward.

text: When you come around a corner or a curve, you should turn the steering wheel while applying the brakes.
explanation: It is dangerous to turn the steering wheel while applying the brakes.

text: In order to assume the proper posture for riding a two-wheeled vehicle, you should place your heels on the footrests, or steps, and insert your toes beneath the brake pedal.
explanation: You should place the arches of your feet on the footrests or steps while pointing your toes forward.

text: Both the front-wheel brake, which is applied by the hand brake lever, and the rear-wheel brake, which is applied by the brake pedal, provide braking action independently on two-wheeled vehicles with manual transmission.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you open the door of a four-wheeled vehicle, it is advisable to open it slightly at first, confirm safety around the vehicle, then open it just as much as necessary.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Mopeds may not pass or overtake other vehicles at a pedestrian crossing, a bicycle crossing or within 30 meters of these crossings.
explanation: You must not pass or overtake in the areas described in the question.

text: When driving in fog, you should reduce the speed, switch on the fog lamps or headlights before visibility falls, and use the centerline or guard railings as a guide.
explanation: When it is foggy, you should drive as the passage describes.

text: When an emergency vehicle approaches you in an area other than at or around an intersection, you must pull over to the left side of the road.
explanation: In the situation described in the question, you should move to the left and yield the road to the emergency vehicle. You do not have to stop.

text: You may not drive taxis or hired limousines for business purposes with a regular first-class driver's license, but you may send round with it.
explanation: Sending round is not regarded as driving for business purposes so you may drive those cars with a regular first-class driver's license.

text: The maximum loading size of regular vehicles whose total engine displacement is 600cc or less, is 2.5 meters from the ground level.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The pavement making shown in the illustration on the right prohibits a vehicle moving in the direction of A or a vehicle moving in the direction of B from crossing over the halfway line and enter a lane moving in the opposite direction for overtaking.
explanation: The vehicle moving in the direction of A may cross over the halfway line for overtaking.

text: You must slow down at an intersection with a laterally obstructed view to the right and left even the intersection is regulated by traffic lights.
explanation: You do not have to slow down at the intersection, which has the right of way, or which is regulated by a traffic light.

text: The maximum speed limit for large-size motorcycles on the main through lanes of a national expressway where no traffic sign or pavement marking is present is 100km/h.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Before proceeding into the crossroad at an intersection you must always stop if the crossroad has the right of way.
explanation: You must always slow down, not stop, in the situation described in the passage of the question.

text: Mopeds, which are required to make a right turn using the two-stage method, also may proceed when the signal is a green arrow pointing to the right.
explanation: Mopeds must not enter intersections.

text: If the engine of your vehicle is overheated you must immediately switch off the engine and pour some water in the radiator.
explanation: You should leave the engine running at low speed for a while, then add some water after the engine has cooled down.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right indicates that there is roadwork ahead and that the road is closed to vehicles.
explanation: This traffic sign indicates that there is roadwork ahead but vehicles are allowed to proceed.

text: When you get out of a vehicle you must always do so on the right side of the car.
explanation: You may get out of a car on the left side when there is a lot of traffic.

text: You do not have to stop at the stop line of a railroad crossing right after the crossing bar has risen.
explanation: You must stop at the stop line.

text: When you leave your four-wheeled vehicle parked on a downhill slope you should shift the gear into the low position. (For a vehicle with automatic transmission, shift the change lever into "P" position.)
explanation: When parking your car on a level ground or on a downslope, you should shift the gear into reverse.

text: You must refrain from driving if you have taken any medication which has a sleep-inducing effect.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The minimum speed limit for driving on the main through lanes of national expressways is regulated; however, there is no minimum speed limit for driving on the main through lanes of motorways.
explanation: The minimum speed limit for driving on the main through lanes of motorways is not regulated by law. (It is the same as driving on public roads.)

text: Since the use of a clutch is not required, driving a vehicle with automatic transmission is considered less demanding and easier. However, driving such a vehicle still requires the same levels of care and responsibility as you do for driving a vehicle with manual transmission.
explanation: You should not take driving vehicles with automatic transmission lightly.

text: The seating capacity listed on the Motor Vehicle Inspection Certificate also counts the driver as one.
explanation: The driver is included in the number of passengers.

text: The pavement marking shown on the right warns drivers that they should not proceed as the arrows indicate because it is dangerous to do so.
explanation: The pavement markings of the question indicate that you may cross over the halfway line and enter the right side of the road.

text: Wheelbase differential refers to the "allowance" when you turn the steering wheel inwardly.
explanation: Wheelbase differential refers to the difference in the paths the front and rear wheels take when executing a turn.

text: Driving a vehicle requires the abilities to recognize, judge, and execute properly. If any one of these abilities were missing, it would lead to accidents.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 50km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you travel on long continuous downhill slopes?
text: If you tilt your motorcycle too much you might slip and collide into the guard railing, so slow down before tilting your motorcycle just so slightly that it turns naturally by itself.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 50km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you travel on long continuous downhill slopes?
text: Since an oncoming vehicle may cross into your side of the road so slow down and drive toward the left side of the road.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 50km/h. What do you have to keep in mind when you travel on long continuous downhill slopes?
text: Two-wheeled vehicles are high in maneuverability so tilt your motorcycle as much as possible when riding through long continuous downhill slopes to take advantage of its structural characteristics.
explanation: If you tilt your motorcycle way too much you might slip and topple over.

scenario: The traffic light has just turned green. What do you have to keep in mind when you proceed forward?
text: The children might attempt to cross the pedestrian crossing, so check the movement of the children first, and then move forward.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: The traffic light has just turned green. What do you have to keep in mind when you proceed forward?
text: The traffic light the children are facing is indicating a red light, so proceed without altering the speed.
explanation: The traffic light may be red but it has just turned to red, so the children may still want to attempt to cross the pedestrian crossing.

scenario: The traffic light has just turned green. What do you have to keep in mind when you proceed forward?
text: Maybe a motorcycle is blocked from your view by the oncoming truck and may attempt to make a right turn from behind, so proceed forward while giving caution to the traffic behind the oncoming truck.
explanation: You might collide with the bicycle. It is dangerous to overtake a wobbling bicycle.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The cyclist is riding with one of his hands holding an umbrella and is prone to wobble, so overtake the bicycle without altering the speed and pass by the oncoming motorcycle.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The bicycle may move to the center to avoid getting into a water puddle ahead of him, so slow down and keep following the bicycle for a while.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The bicycle may wobble, so maintain a safe distance from the bicycle and overtake it after passing by the oncoming motorcycle.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding through the intersection at 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: A motorcycle is approaching from the right, so stop before entering the intersection.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding through the intersection at 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: If you kept going you would collide with the motorcycle, so slow down and yield the way to the motorcycle.
explanation: If you kept going at the same speed, you would collide with the motorcycle. You should yield the way to the motorcycle.

scenario: You are proceeding through the intersection at 40km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The motorcycle on your right as well as the motorcycle behind you have already noticed you, so proceed without altering the speed because the motorcycle on your right will definitely stop.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The door of the truck ahead may suddenly open, so slow down just before the truck and pass it by.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: The bicycle may move into the vehicular lane in an attempt to avoid bumping into the pedestrians, so slow down and give caution to the movement of the bicycle.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

scenario: You are proceeding at a speed of 30km/h. What do you have to keep in mind while driving?
text: Proceed at the same speed and pass by the truck.
explanation: You may collide with the bicycle or the door of the truck.

text: If there are pavement markings of (white) arrows as shown in the diagram, you are allowed to proceed onto the lane while giving caution to the oncoming traffic.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct. (However, you should cross into the other lane as little as possible.)

text: When you approached an intersection on a two-wheeled vehicle, you accelerated and passed through the intersection because the traffic light had just turned yellow.
explanation: You must stop at the stop line. If you are unable to stop safely you may pass through; however, you must not accelerate.

text: On one-way roads the rider of a large-size motorcycle must proceed on the left side of the road.
explanation: You must abide by the rule of keeping to the left even on one-way roads.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right prohibits the passage of vehicles having a width in excess of 2.2 meters including the load or the load-carrying equipment.
explanation: Vehicles having the width in excess of that designated by the traffic sign must not enter the road.

text: If you stop and confirm the safety before entering a railroad crossing, you may proceed forward regardless of the traffic condition ahead.
explanation: You might get stuck inside the railroad crossing if you kept going forward without confirming the condition of the traffic ahead.

text: The maximum load size allowed for a large-size truck is up to the length of the vehicle times 1.2 or less, and the load should not extend over the rear of the vehicle by more than one tenth the length of the vehicle.
explanation: The size restriction of loading methods is correctly described in the passage of the question.

text: When you have to park your four-wheeled vehicle at night on an expressway due to breakdown, you do not have to switch on the hazard lamps or tail lamps as long as you place an emergency warning reflector board behind the vehicle.
explanation: You should use an emergency warning reflector board in addition to switching on the hazard lamps and tail lamps.

text: When riding on a two-wheeled vehicle you would be likely to topple over if you applied the front-wheel brake firmly.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: In the case of an accident you would not be required to report to the police if both parties came to a settlement.
explanation: You must report the accident to the police under any circumstances.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right indicates that there is a bridge ahead so large-size vehicles should look for an alternative road in advance.
explanation: The traffic sign of the question indicates that the road you are proceeding on will be narrowed, so you should move to the center of the road in advance.

text: It is safer to drive at a lower speed when it is raining or at night compared to driving in daylight or when it is sunny.
explanation: Not only do you need to slow down when it is raining or at night, but you also have to maintain a safe distance from the car in front.

text: You are allowed to enter the right-hand side of the road if you are unable to proceed because there is roadwork or similar blocking the left side of the road.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When it starts to rain, the dirt on paved road becomes sludgy and slippery, so you must be extra careful when you drive.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When coming to a stop at an intersection in a four-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you should step on the brake pedal and also apply the hand brake just in case.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you leave your vehicle you should remove the ignition key, lock the doors and put a steering wheel locking device, if any, as a measure against auto theft.
explanation: You should do as the passage describes whenever you leave your vehicle.

text: Since the body of a regular-size motorcycle is relatively small, it is allowed to stop or park at or around the top of a hill.
explanation: No vehicle is allowed to stop or park at or around the top of hills or on steep slopes.

text: A vehicle having the seating capacity of 5 people may carry 1 adult and 5 children under the age of 12 in addition to the driver.
explanation: Seating capacity minus two adults leaves three adults. Therefore only four children are allowed to ride. (3X1.5=4.5, and the decimal point is discarded to 4.)

text: On a road without vehicular lanes you proceeded toward the center of the road in order to avoid being overtaken.
explanation: You must proceed on the left side of the road.

text: When you were about to enter an intersection, an emergency vehicle approached, but you proceeded through the intersection because the traffic light was green.
explanation: You must move away from the intersection, pull over to the left side of the road even when the traffic light is green.

text: If the vehicle in front of you stops or slows down before a railroad crossing, you must not cut in front of the vehicle, however, if the vehicle ahead were a moped (a motorized bicycle,) you would be able to cut in front of it.
explanation: You must not cut in front of a vehicle even if it is a moped.

text: At the time of a massive earthquake the driver of a four-wheeled vehicle must remove the ignition key, close the windows, and lock the doors if it is necessary to abandon the vehicle on a road.
explanation: You should leave the key in the ignition, close the window, and leave without locking the doors.

text: The traffic sign and the traffic light shown on the right have the same meanings.
explanation: Both the traffic sign and traffic light indicate that you may proceed after stopping at the stop line and confirming the safety.

text: Even during daytime hours you must switch on the headlights inside a tunnel if visibility falls below 50 meters.
explanation: Even during the day, you must turn on the headlights in the situation described in the passage.

text: While riding a large- or regular-size motorcycle you may wear a hard-hat for construction use.
explanation: A hard-hat for construction use is not the same as a crash helmet and it is not acceptable for riding motorcycles.

text: Vehicles other than route buses that are proceeding in the priority lanes for buses must leave the priority lanes immediately if a bus approaches.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: A person who has had his/her license suspended must not ride mopeds during the period of suspension.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right refers to the end of traffic regulation designating the maximum speed limit of 50km/h.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you turn the steering wheel too quickly your vehicle is apt to be overturned due to the effect of centrifugal force.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Before entering expressways you should check the levels of gas, coolant, and oil of your engine and the depth of the tire tread, and make sure to carry an emergency warning reflector board with you.
explanation: Before entering expressways, you should inspect your vehicle as described in the passage.

text: When proceeding on national expressways or motor highways you may drive at any speed if the maximum speed limit is not specified by traffic signs or pavement markings.
explanation: You must observe the maximum speed limit designated by law. (The maximum speed limit for motor highways is the same as that of public roads.)

text: It is prohibited to stop or park at a railroad crossing or within 10 meters of it, however, you may stop within the area for getting in and out of vehicles.
explanation: You must not stop or park within the area even for getting in and out of vehicles.

text: Even if you have had a regular driver's license for more than a year and a regular-size motorcycle license for less than a year, you would still be considered as a newly licensed driver as far as the regular-size motorcycle license is concerned.
explanation: You will be placed into the category of newly licensed drivers for a period of one year for each license you obtain.

text: If the headlights of oncoming vehicles are too bright to your eyes, you should look directly at them so as to adjust your eyes to the brightness.
explanation: Do not look directly into the headlights, or your eyes will be dazzled. You should look ahead slightly toward the left of the oncoming vehicles.

text: You do not have to switch on the headlights at night if you can see the vehicles and pedestrians in the traffic well enough due to the road lighting or the shopping street lighting.
explanation: You must turn on the headlights during nighttime hours regardless of the brightness of the surrounding area.

text: Roads marked by the traffic sign shown on the right cannot be used by large trucks, special medium-size trucks or special heavy equipment.
explanation: A truck or special heavy equipment whose gross weight exceeds 8,000kg or whose loading capacity exceeds 5,000kg is not allowed to proceed.

text: When proceeding on an expressway in dense fog and visibility falls below 200 meters you must turn on the headlights even during the daytime hours.
explanation: You must turn on the headlights as the passage describes.

text: When inspecting the hand brake, it is better to have larger allowance when the hand brake lever is fully applied.
explanation: The allowance should not be too large or too small.

text: In order to assume the proper posture for riding a two-wheeled vehicle with automatic transmission, you should put the entire soles of your shoes on the steps and point your toes forward without letting them protrude outward of the steps.
explanation: When you ride a two-wheeled vehicle, assume the proper riding posture described in the passage.

text: The traffic sign shown on the right refers to a "shelter," so when you are proceeding on an uphill slope, you must enter the shelter and wait until vehicles going down the slope have passed through the area.
explanation: You must enter the shelter and wait as the passage describes.

text: You do not have to signal when you change lanes to the left because it is not the same as turning to the left.
explanation: You must signal when you change lanes.

text: When you spot a vehicle stopped in front of a pedestrian crossing you must first stop before passing beside the vehicle and proceed forward.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The driver's seat of large vehicles or medium-size vehicles, semi medium-size vehicles is located higher than regular vehicles. As a result of it the driver of such a vehicle has to look down and feels the distance between his car and the vehicle in front longer than the actual distance. So, the distance between such vehicles tends to be shorter.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: At a railroad crossing equipped with a crossing bar, you proceeded through the railroad crossing without stopping because the crossing bar was raised.
explanation: You must stop and confirm the safety before entering the railroad crossing even when the crossing bar is raised.

text: I drove a cargo vehicle, whose maximum loading capacity was four tons, with my regular license.
explanation: When you drive a cargo vehicle, whose maximum loading capacity is more than three tons, you must have a semi medium license or medium license or large license.

text: A school bus was stopped in the oncoming lane to drop children off, so you accelerated a little to pass by it.
explanation: You must slow down and confirm the safety even for a school bus stopped in the oncoming lane.

text: A towing license is required in addition to a regular driver's license when a regular vehicle with a total weight of 750kg is towed by a regular passenger vehicle.
explanation: You do not need a towing license in the situation described in the question.

text: When you apply the brakes on a four-wheeled vehicle, except in the case of an emergency, you should step on the brake pedal lightly, then gradually increase pressure until you obtain the optimal degree of braking.
explanation: When applying brakes, you should follow the description of the passage.

text: When proceeding on an expressway on a two-wheeled vehicle having a total engine displacement of 250cc, you may ride double if you are over the age of 20 and have had a regular-size motorcycle license for more than 3 years, even if the motorcycle does not have a pillion seat.
explanation: You must not ride double on motorcycles without a pillion seat.

text: If you happen to splash a pedestrian with muddy water while driving, you must be held responsible even if you were careful not to splash water around by reducing your speed.
explanation: It is the responsibility of the driver as described in the passage.

text: The rear view mirror of a regular passenger car is better than the side mirrors in making an accurate visual estimation of the distance between your vehicle and the one behind.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: The method of turning to the right as depicted by the arrow shown in the illustration is correct.
explanation: As depicted by the arrow, you should move to the center of the road, and proceed at a reduced speed to the point just short of the center of the intersection before executing the right turn.

text: The radiator and fan are designed to prevent the engine from overheating.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: It is advisable to refrain from signaling with your hands because the hand signals are confusing to other drivers.
explanation: Hand signals are very useful at the time of the day when the direction indicator lamps and others are difficult to see because of the reflection of the sunlight.

text: You must not stop on the main through lanes of expressways under any circumstances.
explanation: You may stop for alleviating dangers.

text: Where the traffic sign shown on the right is present, vehicles other than two-wheeled vehicles may pass through.
explanation: The traffic sign of the question designates "Road closed to all vehicles except motorcycles."

text: The number shown on the inspection emblem indicate the month and the year of the next inspection date.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: Stopping your vehicle for over 5 minutes for loading and unloading packages would still be regarded as stopping and not as parking.
explanation: If you stop for over 5 minutes for loading and unloading packages, it will be considered as parking.

text: When you ride a motorcycle at night, it is advisable to wear reflective clothes and a crash helmet with a reflector affixed.
explanation: You are advised to wear reflective clothes during nighttime hours as indicated by the passage of the question.

text: Unless there is a traffic sign allowing vehicles to proceed into streetcar tracks, you should not enter the streetcar tracks except when overtaking other vehicles.
explanation: You may not enter the streetcar tracks except when making right or left turns.

text: The maximum speed limit for riding mopeds on public roads, where it is not designated by traffic signs or pavement markings, is 30km/h.
explanation: The maximum speed limit of mopeds is 30km/h.

text: Since a moped in front was wobbling its way, you attempted to overtake the moped, but you realized that a car behind you was just about to overtake your vehicle, so you decided not to overtake the moped.
explanation: It is dangerous to overtake in the situation described in the passage.

text: When you drive with a learner's permit, you must display a "Learner Driver" sign on either the front or back of the vehicle you drive.
explanation: You must affix the signs on both the front and back of the vehicle you drive.

text: At an intersection with traffic lights, you may proceed as soon as the traffic light facing the crossroad turns red, because no traffic would be entering the intersection from the crossroad.
explanation: Even if the traffic light of the crossroad is red, it does not necessarily mean that the traffic light you are facing is green.

text: When you proceed on a road without vehicular lanes, you are under no obligation to yield the road to vehicles approaching and passing you from behind.
explanation: If the vehicle behind you is attempting to overtake you, you should yield the road to that vehicle.

text: The main through lanes refer to the lanes of expressways (that exclude the entry acceleration lanes, exit deceleration lanes, climbing lanes, side strips, and shoulder zones) where vehicles normally drive at high speeds.
explanation: The main through lanes are those lanes referred to in the passage of the question.

text: Load size allowed for mopeds is less than 2 meters from the load-carrying platform.
explanation: Load size allowed for mopeds is less than 2 meters from the ground level, and it is not less than 2 meters from the load-carrying platform.

text: You must not drive too close to, or cut in front of, a car which is displaying the mark shown on the right, except when it is necessary to do so in an attempt to obviate danger.
explanation: You should not drive too close or cut in front of vehicles driven by newly licensed drivers.

text: You may sound the car horn if it is inevitable in circumventing danger, even if there is a school or a hospital nearby.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When the left half of a road is 6 meters or more in width, you must not enter the right-hand side of the road to overtake other vehicles.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you proceed on gravel roads it is advisable to shift the gear into the low position and drive slowly.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: If the speed at the time of collision is reduced to one-half, the impact of the collision will be quartered.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: You would have "slowed down" if you reduced the speed from 60km/h to 20km/h.
explanation: Slowing down refers to reducing to a speed at which you can come to an immediate halt.

text: The pavement markings shown on the right indicate that there is a pedestrian crossing or a bicycle crossing ahead and that you must slow down.
explanation: The pavement markings of the question indicate that there is a priority road ahead.

text: When you spotted a child who was totally caught up in playing and did not notice a bike was approaching, you sounded your car horn and passed beside the child at a high speed because you anticipated that the child would dash out in front of you.
explanation: It is dangerous to pass by a child at a high speed because he/she might dash out.

text: When turning to the left vehicles must move toward the left side of the road in advance, and proceed at a reduced speed along the periphery of the intersection.
explanation: When making a left turn, you should follow the description of the passage.

text: A driver who caused an accident must take total responsibility for the accident, while the owner of a vehicle who has left the doors of the car unlocked and ended up having his/her car stolen, should not be held responsible for the accident.
explanation: The owner of the vehicle should have taken measures against auto theft.

text: You should confirm safe conditions not only before getting in the vehicle but also after signaling to move forward.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: When you close the doors of a four-wheeled vehicle it is important that you apply enough force to close it all the way with one push.
explanation: When you close a door, it should be pulled just short of closing, then apply enough force to pull it shut.

text: While riding on a motorcycle you proceed through the side strip at a reduced speed because there was a lot of traffic.
explanation: You must not proceed on the side strip.

text: When you attempt to change lanes while moving in one direction, you should signal 3 seconds in advance of changing lanes.
explanation: You should signal in the manner described in the passage of the question.

text: If you parked and waited for someone to come for 5 minutes on a road where it was prohibited to park, it would be considered as illegal parking.
explanation: You would be violating parking regulations as mentioned in the passage.

text: When you drive across a side strip to enter or exit a parking structure located alongside the road, you must first stop before crossing the side strip and try not to impede the progress of pedestrians.
explanation: You must stop before crossing the side strip even if there is no pedestrian.

text: On a road where the traffic sign shown on the right is present you must not proceed forward or make right turns.
explanation: The traffic sign of the question does not prohibit vehicles from proceeding forward or making a right turn. The sign designates "No vehicle crossing," and vehicles are prohibited from crossing.

text: Except on rainy days, you do not have to be concerned about going into a skid, even if the wear limit indicator of the tire is exposed.
explanation: You should change the tire when the wear limit indicator is exposed.

text: You may ride a moped without taking out a policy in compulsory automobile liability insurance.
explanation: You must have a policy in compulsory automobile liability insurance when you ride a moped.

text: When you choose a two-wheeled vehicle you should choose the one with the right size so that your toes barely touch the ground when you mount the motorcycle.
explanation: You should select a motorcycle having the size that allows the tips of your feet to touch the ground when you mount.

text: When turning right at an intersection, an oncoming vehicle approached towards you. You would not be impeding the progress of the vehicle if you went ahead and made the turn causing the oncoming vehicle to come to a sudden stop, because you were at the intersection first.
explanation: Even when you entered the intersection first, you must not impede the progress of the oncoming traffic traveling forward.

text: When you leave the main through lanes, you must reduce the speed sufficiently on the main through lane before going into the exit deceleration lane.
explanation: You must reduce the speed after going into the exit deceleration lane.

text: Large-size trucks must not exceed the speed limit of 40km/h on roads where the traffic sign shown to the right is present.
explanation: The passage of the question is correct.

text: While riding a two-wheeled vehicle, the driver of a four-wheeled vehicle will not overlook your motorcycle as long as you are within eyeshot of the car driver.
explanation: The drivers of four-wheeled vehicles have a tendency to be inattentive toward motorcycles, and it is possible that they overlook your motorcycle as well.
